text_logic_form: The sum of the circumferences of the circles with centers $H$, $J$, and $K$ is $56pi$.
Find the length of the line $KJ$.
dissolved_text_logic_form: The sum of the circumferences of the circles with centers $H$, $J$, and $K$ is $56pi$.
Find the length of the line $KJ$.
diagram_logic_form: The length of the line $KA$ is $4x$ units.
The length of the line $CG$ is $2x$ units.
The length of the line $HA$ is $x$ units.
The length of the line $HC$ is $x$ units.
Point $C$ lies on the line connecting $J$ and $H$.
Point $B$ lies on the line connecting $J$ and $K$.
Point $A$ lies on the line connecting $K$ and $H$.
Point $B$ lies on the circumference of the circle with center $J$.
Point $C$ also lies on the circumference of the circle with center $J$.
Point $A$ lies on the circumference of the circle with center $K$.
Point $B$ also lies on the circumference of the circle with center $K$.
Point $A$ lies on the circumference of the circle with center $H$.
Point $C$ also lies on the circumference of the circle with center $H$.
line_instances: There are lines $HA$, $HC$, $JB$, $JC$, $JH$, $JK$, $KA$, $KB$, and $KH$ forming the diagram.
circle_instances: There are three circles with centers at points $J$, $K$, and $H$.
